div.p: Updated! There are several road and bicycle pathway construction projects taking place throughout the Township. Subdivision resurfacing work is expected to begin later this year. 174th Avenue 174th Ave between Taft St and Van Wagoner Rd will be closed beginning September 3 for sewer installation. Work is expected to last through September 13. The detour will utilize Taft St and Dogwood Dr. West Spring Lake Road West Spring Lake Rd will be resurfaced beginning the week of August 26. Work will...

img.alt: Board of Trustees Update – August 12 Meeting

h2.a: Board of Trustees Update – August 12 Meeting

div.p: The Spring Lake Township Board of Trustees met on Monday, August 12, for our regular monthly board meeting. If you werenâ€™t able to tune in to the meeting, you can watch it on our Facebook page. Here are a few of the items the Board discussed or acted on during the meeting. 2024-25 Budget Amendments We are one-third of the way through our current fiscal year, and the Board approved proposed budget amendments for our current budget. The net amount of these amendments shows no change to our...

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blog_2 wt-home-blog et_pb_blog_grid_wrapper et_pb_bg_layout_light

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_2_0 post-1 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-homepage-news-3 category-uncategorized

div.p: Burn Days in 2024 are March 16, May 18, July 20, September 21 and November 16. Only brush may be burned. No burning within 1400 feet of Ferrysburg or the Village of Spring Lake. A permit is required. Permits are valid for a calendar year.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blog_3 wt-home-blog et_pb_blog_grid_wrapper et_pb_bg_layout_light

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_blog_item_3_0 post-1714 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-homepage-news-4

div.p: Summer tax bills have been mailed. Summer tax bills are due September 16, 2024. Mail your tax payments (check only) to Spring Lake Township - Tax Department 8708 PO Box 30516 Lansing, MI 48909-8016 Tax payments can be made in person, by mail, or online. An auto-debit program is also available. Drop boxes are available on the front of the building or behind the building. Payments may also be made online (credit card only). Fees apply. Make an Online Payment Tax and Assessing information is...

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blog_4 news-5 et_pb_blog_grid_wrapper et_pb_bg_layout_light

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb et_pb_blog_item_4_0 post-10 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-homepage-news-5

div.p: Rycenga Park is located at 16401 Hemlock Road.

Shelter reservations are accepted for May 15 to September 30. Available reservation times are 9am to 2:30pm and 3:30pm to 9pm. Reservation fees are $45 for Township residents and $65 for nonresidents per half-day block. Note – we are sharing a reservation system with the Village of Spring Lake, so the link is to a Village site.
Bathrooms are not heated and opening is weather dependent. They are generally open from the middle of May to the end of September. There is a permanent portable toilet at the park.
Electricity is provided in the shelters. If the outlets are overloaded, the GFI circuit may trip. Please try using the reset button on the outlet before calling for help.
Dogs must be leashed. No dogs are allowed on the playground or the athletic fields.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_blog_5 news-6 et_pb_blog_grid_wrapper et_pb_bg_layout_light

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix et_pb_no_thumb et_pb_blog_item_5_0 post-2290 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-homepage-news-6

div.p: Ordinance 255 regulating short-term rentals, was effective February 6, 2017. Short Term Rental definitions were updated in Ordinance 278, effective November 16, 2020.

Short term rentals are not allowed for properties zoned R-1 or R-2. They are allowed in other residential zoning districts. There is a moratorium on short term rentals in the Agricultural and Rural Residential Zoning Districts until February, 2025.

Short term rentals are required to be registered. The registration is valid for 3 years, after which it must be renewed. The registration fee is $100, which may be paid by cash or by check made out to Spring Lake Township.
We will drive past your rental before your registration is approved to verify the condition of the property.
